verbs.description: President Trump [V: has] instructed the commerce secretary to investigate whether imported autos pose a threat to national security , a move that could further strain relations with global allies .

[ARG0: President Trump] has [V: instructed] [ARG1: the commerce secretary] [ARG2: to investigate whether imported autos pose a threat to national security , a move that could further strain relations with global allies] .

President Trump has instructed [ARG0: the commerce secretary] to [V: investigate] [ARG1: whether imported autos pose a threat to national security , a move that could further strain relations with global allies] .

President Trump has instructed the commerce secretary to investigate whether [V: imported] [ARG1: autos] pose a threat to national security , a move that could further strain relations with global allies .

President Trump has instructed the commerce secretary to investigate whether [ARG0: imported autos] [V: pose] [ARG1: a threat to national security] , a move that could further strain relations with global allies .
President Trump has instructed the commerce secretary to investigate whether imported autos pose a threat to national security , a move that [V: could] further strain relations with global allies .

President Trump has instructed the commerce secretary to investigate whether imported autos pose a threat to national security , [ARG0: a move] [R-ARG0: that] [ARGM-MOD: could] [ARGM-EXT: further] [V: strain] [ARG1: relations with global allies] .
